item.title: KKR eyes market blitz of up to six IPOs
item.description: The world’s biggest buy-out group is preparing up to six companies for initial public offerings worth billions of dollars, as it sells some of its most valuable groups back to the stock market

item.title: Back-to-school shift helps US media
item.description: A spike in higher education enrolments in the US has shown up this week in earnings announcements from companies in the otherwise hard-hit media sector, whose education divisions have far outperformed their better-known news brands

item.title: US drives its claws into scrappage deals
item.description: Barack Obama’s administration and members of Congress were scrambling to find ways of extending a scrappage scheme after an avalanche of applications exhausted its $1bn budget within days of launch

item.title: India rejects emissions cuts for a decade
item.description: New Delhi will not discuss signing up to legally binding obligations to make absolute cuts in greenhouse gas emissions for at least 10 years, said the country’s environment minister

item.title: US stocks close month with hefty gains
item.description: US equities settled mixed on Friday, but closed out July with solid gains as data on the economy suggested the vehemence of the recession was abating and expansion beckoned in the third quarter

item.title: Three more directors quit BofA
item.description: Bank of America announced the departure of three more directors, adding to the exodus of allies of Ken Lewis, chief executive, in the past three months and paving the way for new members to join the board

item.title: US and UBS strike deal on client identities
item.description: The US and Switzerland reached an agreement on the closely watched dispute over whether UBS should be forced to reveal the identities of thousands of its American clients

item.title: Cash squeeze hits oil industry
item.description: Eni of Italy has become the first big oil company to cut its dividend in the downturn, announcing a 23% cut in its interim pay-out to €0.50

item.title: Former Philippine president Aquino dies aged 76
item.description: Catapulted from an uncharismatic housewife to an international symbol of ‘People Power’ as Filipinos rid themselves of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos in 1986

item.title: Foxtons founder says slump close to an end
item.description: Jon Hunt, the Foxtons estate agency founder who picked the top of the housing boom in 2007, sees buying opportunities in some areas again
